Title: Arthur Gorrie Correctional Centre
Name: Arthur Gorrie Correctional Centre
Location Description: Arthur Gorrie Correctional Centre is privately managed and operated by GEO Group Australia under contract to Queensland Corrective Services. It is the current remand centre for south-east Queensland.
Booking times:
Monday-Friday 8.30-11am and 1pm-4.30pm

Saturday and Sundays 9.30-11am and 1pm-4pm
Visiting:
###Mainstream

**Monday, Wednesday and Saturday**

- 9-11am and 1.30-3pm
- 10-11am

**Thursday**

- 1.30-3pm

**Friday**

- 9-11am

**Sunday**

- 9-11am
- 10-11am

###Protection

**Tuesday and Thursday**

- 9-11am
- 10-11am

**Friday and Saturday**

- 1.30-3pm
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Arthur Gorrie Correctional Centre. 

There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact the Prison Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379. 

Mobility services can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
Only 3 adults and a reasonable number of children may visit each prisoner.
 
Only the names submitted when the visit was booked will be allowed access to the centre on the visiting day. 

For more information see [Visiting a prisoner](http://www.qld.gov.au/law/sentencing-prisons-and-probation/prisons-and-detention-centres/visiting-a-prisoner/visiting-a-prisoner/).

Title: Borallon Training and Correctional Centre
Name: Borallon Training and Correctional Centre
Booking times:
To book a visit, please call the visits booking line on (07) 5460 8407 on Monday (12:00pm-4:00 pm), Tuesday and Wednesday (9:00am-12:00pm and 1:00pm-4:00pm). 

When making a booking, visitors will be requested to advise whether they are visiting during the morning or the afternoon session.

Visit bookings are not taken on public holidays.  

Prisoners are permitted up to two hours per session of approved visits.
Booking arrival times:
Visitors may arrive at the centre at any time between 9:15am and 2:15pm.  Upon arrival, visitors are requested to wait in the Visits Shelter area in the carpark.  Staff will collect visitors at the following times:

- 9.15am
- 10.30am
- 12.40pm 
- 2.15pm
Transport: A bus service is available for visitors to Borallon Training and Correctional Centre.  There is no charge to visitors for this service.  For further information, contact Prison Transport Group Incorporated on Toll Free 1800 334 379 between 10.00am and 2.00pm Tuesday to Friday or visit their website at www.prisontransport.com.au. Mobility services can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
Mobile telephones, tobacco and other smoking related products are prohibited items within the Borallon Training and Correctional Centre. Smoking is not permitted anywhere in the grounds of the Borallon Training and Correctional Centre including carparks, walkways, and visits processing. These items must not be taken into the correctional centre, and must be secured in a vehicle. 

For visitors attending the centre using Prison Transport Group Incorporated, these items may be secured in a locker in A Block.  Smoking is not permitted anywhere in the grounds of a correctional centre, including car parks, walkways, visits processing etc.

Title: Brisbane Correctional Centre
Name: Brisbane Correctional Centre
Location Description:
Brisbane Correctional Centre is the primary reception centre for newly-sentenced male prisoners in south-east Queensland.

Upon arrival, new prisoners are inducted into the correctional system, have their risks and needs assessed and have an offender management plan formulated to cover the duration of their sentence.

Prisoners are then transferred to suitable correctional centres elsewhere in Queensland to complete their sentence.

Brisbane Correctional Centre also has an operational maximum security unit.
Booking times:
Monday 12pm-3.30pm 

Tuesday to Thursday 8am-12pm and 1-3.30pm 

Friday 8am-12pm

Bookings will NOT be taken outside of these hours. 

Visitor bookings must be made at least 24 hours prior to the intended
visit session.
Booking arrival times:
First time visit  - arrive 1 hour before

Return visits - arrive 45 minutes before
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Brisbane Correctional Centre. There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact the Prison Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379. 

Mobility services can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
Contact visits may include up to 3 adults and 4 children per visit.

Non contact visits may include up to 2 adults and 2 children per visit.

Prior approval from the General Manager for children is required.

Only visitors booked prior to the visit will be permitted to attend the visits sessions.

Contact visits are subject to approval by the General Manager following a criminal history check. - Visitors may request non contact visits pending this approval, which may take up to 6 weeks.

For more information see [Visiting a prisoner](http://www.qld.gov.au/law/sentencing-prisons-and-probation/prisons-and-detention-centres/visiting-a-prisoner/visiting-a-prisoner/).

Title: Brisbane Women's Correctional Centre
Name: Brisbane Women's Correctional Centre
Location Description:
Brisbane Women's Correctional Centre is the only reception, assessment and placement centre for female prisoners in southern Queensland.

The centre has a structured daily program consisting of industry, education and vocational training programs that provide opportunities to address offending behaviour, and a range of activities designed to enhance personal development.

The Helana Jones Centre and Numinbah (female) Correctional Centre are annexures to this centre.
Booking times:
Monday-Wednesday 8.30am-12pm and 1pm-3.30pm.

Bookings will not be taken outside these hours.
 
Permanent bookings are available, but must be requested by a prisoner.
Booking arrival times:
First time visit  - arrive 45 minutes before

Return visits - arrive 30 minutes before
Visiting:
###Protection

**Tuesday, Wednesday and Saturday**  

- 8:45am-10:45am

###Secure

**Monday, Thursday and Friday** 

- 8:45am - 9:45am

**Sunday**

- 8:45am - 9:45am and 10.15am - 11.15am

###Residential

**Monday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday** 

- 1:15pm - 3:15pm
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Brisbane Women's Correctional Centre. There is no charge to visitors for this service.

Visitors MUST be an approved visitor to use this service.

For further information, contact the Prison Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379. 

Mobility service can be accommodated if required.

Title: Capricornia Correctional Centre
Name: Capricornia Correctional Centre
Location Description: Capricornia Correctional Centre is located 20 kilometres north of Rockhampton and provides facilities for remand, reception and sentenced prisoners.
Postal address:
Locked Mail Bag 11  
Redhill Rockhampton QLD 4701
Booking times:
Tuesday 9am-11.30am and 12.30-3.30pm 

Wednesday and Thursday 12.30-3.30pm  

Bookings will not be taken outside these hours.
Booking arrival times:
Arrive at the centre at least 45 minutes before the visit is due to start.

Be prepared to leave the visits area at least 20 minutes before the start of your visit. 

Visitors who arrive after this time may not be accepted.
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Capricornia Correctional Centre. There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact the Prisoner Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379.

Mobility services can be accommodated if required.

Title: Helana Jones Centre
Name: Helana Jones Centre
Location Description: The Helana Jones Centre, located at Albion, accommodates low risk female prisoners in home style accommodation.
Booking times:
Monday-Thursday 1-3pm

Bookings will not be taken outside these hours.
Booking arrival times: Arrive at the centre 15 minutes before
Additional Information:
Only approved food and drink items are permitted on visits.

Visitors are to ensure they have appropriate forms of identification to show to centre staff.

Mail box size lockers are provided for the storage of personal items (e.g. mobile phones, wallets).
 
For more information see [Visiting a prisoner](http://www.qld.gov.au/law/sentencing-prisons-and-probation/prisons-and-detention-centres/visiting-a-prisoner/visiting-a-prisoner/).

Title: Lotus Glen Correctional Centre
Name: Lotus Glen Correctional Centre
Location Description: The Lotus Glen Correctional Centre, located 25 kilometres south of Mareeba, accommodates high and low security prisoners and provides a remand and reception function north of Innisfail.
Booking arrival times:
Visits to the centre arrive at least 1 hour before

Visits to the farm arrive at least 15 minutes before
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Lotus Glen Correctional Centre. There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact the Down Under Tours (Aust) Pty Ltd on Non Toll Free (07) 4047 9080. 

Mobility services can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
Before entering the centre, visitors are required to empty their pockets and place the contents and any other valuables in a locker. 

This includes mobile telephones, money, cigarettes, food and drink and jewellery.

Toilets should be accessed at the visiting processing centre prior to proceeding to the visit area. 
Visitors who require access to toilets during a visit may have their visit terminated, or revert to non-contact.

Title: Maryborough Correctional Centre
Name: Maryborough Correctional Centre
Location Description: Maryborough Correctional Centre, located about 7 kilometres north of Maryborough, is a multi-purpose, secure custody facility, that acts as a remand and reception centre.
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Maryborough Correctional Centre. There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact Hinter Coast Transport on Toll Free 1300 658 971. 

Mobility can be accommodated if required.

Title: Numinbah Correctional Centre
Name: Numinbah Correctional Centre
Location Description: Numinbah Correctional Centre is a low security centre for female prisoners located 100 kilometres south of Brisbane in the Gold Coast hinterland.
Transport:
Visitors can access a visitor transport service. Bookings are essential through Prison Transport Group on 1800 334 379. 

The service runs every Sunday, departing from Roma Street in Brisbane, with a pickup/drop off stop in Beenleigh. 

Passengers need to arrive 15 minutes prior to departure.
Additional Information:
No food or drink items are permitted to be brought into the centre. 

All drinks for infants and babies must be in sealed plastic bottles. 

Soft drinks are available for purchase from vending machines. 

Tea, coffee and cold water facilities are available.

No money or property are permitted to be brought into the visits area for prisoners. These items must be posted into the facility for processing. 

Coins may be brought in only to purchase soft drinks from the vending machines. 

For more information see [Visiting a prisoner](http://www.qld.gov.au/law/sentencing-prisons-and-probation/prisons-and-detention-centres/visiting-a-prisoner/visiting-a-prisoner/).

Title: Palen Creek Correctional Centre
Name: Palen Creek Correctional Centre
Location Description: Palen Creek Correctional Centre is situated about 100 kilometres south of Brisbane and is designed to accommodate low security male prisoners.
Booking times:
Tuesday-Wednesday 9-11am and 1-3pm

Friday 9-10am (for prisoners transferred on a Thursday)

Permanent bookings are available, but can only be arranged by prisoners.
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Palen Creek Correctional Centre. There is no charge to visitors for this service. 

Visitors MUST be an approved visitor to use this service.

For further information, contact the Prison Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379.
 
Mobility services can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
No food, drink or tobacco products are permitted to be brought in. However, an exception will be given to drinks for infants and babies provided they are in a sealed plastic bottle or can.
 
No plastic bottles or containers larger than 750mls are permitted.

Bottle warming facilities are provided for warming baby bottles and a refrigerator for storing baby requirements is available.

Visitors may bring coins on visits to purchase soft drinks through the vending machine.
No money (cash, cheques or money orders) will be accepted by staff for prisoners during weekend visit sessions.

These items can be sent by mail only.

Hand in property must be approved by the centre prior to arriving at the centre, otherwise it will be returned to the sender. 

For more information see [Visiting a prisoner](http://www.qld.gov.au/law/sentencing-prisons-and-probation/prisons-and-detention-centres/visiting-a-prisoner/visiting-a-prisoner/).

Title: Southern Queensland Correctional Centre
Name: Southern Queensland Correctional Centre
Location Description:
The Southern Queensland Correctional Centre, located near Gatton in the Lockyer Valley. 

SQCC is the first completed stage of the Southern Queensland Correctional Precinct.

Serco Australia Pty Ltd is contracted to manage and operate the centre for QCS.

The centre provides secure placement for sentenced mainstream male prisoners classified as high or low security.
Booking times:
Monday, Wednesday and Thursday 9am-3pm

Tuesday 9am-12pm

Friday 9am-12pm (new prisoners only for Saturday/Sunday visits)
Booking arrival times:
Saturday and Sunday arrive 8.30-11.15am or 12.30-3.15pm

Wednesday arrive 9.30-11.15am or 12.30- 3.15pm
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Southern Queensland Correctional Centre. There is no charge to visitors for this service. 

Visitors MUST be an approved visitor to use this service.

Booking times for Prison Transport Group are Tuesday to Thursday between 10am to 2pm and Friday between 10am to 4pm.

For further information, contact the Prison Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379. 

Mobility service can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
Prisoners' visits entitlements change in accordance with their Incentives and Earned Privileges status.

For more information see [Visiting a prisoner](http://www.qld.gov.au/law/sentencing-prisons-and-probation/prisons-and-detention-centres/visiting-a-prisoner/visiting-a-prisoner/).

Title: Townsville Correctional Centre
Name: Townsville Correctional Centre
Location Description:
Townsville's 2 high security correctional centres are located at Stuart, 12 kilometres west of the North Queensland city. 

Townsville Correctional Centre (TCC) is a high security men's facility. The male centre has an adjoining low security farm facility. 

Townsville Women's Correctional Centre includes a specialist mothers and babies unit and has an adjoining low security centre.
Visiting:
###Secure Male
 
**Saturday**
 
- 9.30am-10.45am

###S18/S19, McCann accommodation, Village accommodation 

**Saturday and Sunday** 

- 12.15pm-1.45pm

###McCann accommodation and Village accommodation

**Saturday and Sunday**

- 2.45pm-4.00pm

###Protection Male 

**Sunday** 

- 9.30am-10.45am

###Male Farm Complex

**Saturday and Sunday**

- 12.45pm-4pm

###Womens

**Saturday and Sunday**

- 9.30am-10.45am
- 12.15pm-1.45pm
- 2.45pm-3.45pm

##Womens low/open

**Saturday and Sunday**

- 12.15pm-4.15pm
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Townsville Correctional Centre. 

There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact the North Qld Prisoners Aid Society Inc. on Non Toll Free 4772 3330. 

Mobility services can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
The maximum number of visitors per offender is:

- three adult visitors and 4 children for mainstream and protection sessions
- four adult visitors and 4 children for women's sessions
- five adult visitors and children for male farm sessions and women's base work camp sessions.

There are no toilet facilities available at the prisoner visits area. 

Toilet facilities are available in the administration building for visitors to use before and after their visit session. 

Personal lockers are available for visitors in the foyer of the visits area. 

There are dress and behaviour standards that visitors must adhere to.

Title: Wolston Correctional Centre
Name: Wolston Correctional Centre
Location Description: Wolston Correctional Centre, adjacent to Brisbane Women's Correctional Centre at Wacol, is a high security placement centre.
Booking times:
Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday 8am-12pm and 1-3.30pm

The visits bookings line is not available on public holidays. 

Permanent bookings are available, but must be requested by the prisoner.
Visiting:
###Secure

** Thursday  and Friday** 

- 8:15am - 9:15am
- 9:45am - 10:45am
- 11:15am - 12:15pm

**Saturday and Sunday** 

- 8:30am -  9:30am
- 10:00am - 11:00am

###Residential

**Thursday and Friday** 

- 1:15pm - 2:15pm
- 2:45pm - 3:45pm
- 4:45pm - 5:45pm

**Saturday and Sunday** 

- 12:45pm - 1:45pm
- 2:30pm - 3:30pm
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Wolston Correctional Centre.
 
There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact the Prison Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379.
 
Mobility service can be accommodated if required.
Additional Information:
Nappies will be provided at the centre. Visitors may bring in 1 bottle and 1 bib (containers are not permitted).

No hand-washing facilities are available inside the centre.

No cigarettes, money or drinks are allowed to be brought into the centre.

Visitors are required to adhere to an appropriate dress standards when entering the centre.

If you are visiting and do not meet the appropriate standards of dress, you may be declined a visit.

For more information see [Visiting a prisoner](http://www.qld.gov.au/law/sentencing-prisons-and-probation/prisons-and-detention-centres/visiting-a-prisoner/visiting-a-prisoner/).

Title: Woodford Correctional Centre
Name: Woodford Correctional Centre
Location Description:
Woodford Correctional Centre is situated about 100 kilometres north of Brisbane in the rural community of Woodford. 

The centre is specifically-designed for high security male prisoners including a maximum security unit.
Transport:
A bus service is available for visitors to the Woodford Correctional Centre.
 
There is no charge to visitors for this service.

For further information, contact the Prison Transport Group on Toll Free 1800 334 379.
 
Mobility service can be accommodated if required.
